text:
I tested tomcat thru mod_jk and noted the following error:
+++
     [java]  [watchdog]  Unable to find the expected header: 'Location:
http://localhost:80/RedirectedTest' in the server's response.
     [java]  [watchdog]  The following headers were received:
     [java]  [watchdog]         HEADER -> Date: Mon, 11 Feb 2002 11:41:19 GMT
     [java]  [watchdog]         HEADER -> Location:
http://localhost/RedirectedTest
     [java]  [watchdog]         HEADER -> Server: Apache/1.3.22 (Unix)
mod_jk/1.2.0
     [java]  [watchdog]         HEADER -> Content-Type: text/html
     [java]  [watchdog]         HEADER -> Connection: close
     [java]  [watchdog]  FAILED SendRedirectTest
     [java]  [watchdog]         (GET /servlet-tests/SendRedirectTest HTTP/1.0)
+++
I think watchdog should mark this test as success.

The following tests are returning error and should return success:
RedirectedTest, RedirectedTest, HttpServletResponseWrapperRedirectedTest and
HttpServletResponseWrapperRedirectedTest.
creator: jfclere@gmail.com
jfclere@gmail.com
text:
I have hit commit too fast:
The related tests are:
SendRedirectTest
SendRedirectForWebAppTest
HttpServletResponseWrapperSendRedirectTest
HttpServletResponseWrapperSendRedirectForWebAppTest
and HttpServletRequestWrapperGetRequestURLTest

creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
text:
Tests and test driver assumed that port information would always be present.
This is not the case for port 80.

Fix verified by submitter.
